cluster_relations.rel_desc: The ability to connect regardless of physical distance enhances human communication in contemporary society.
cluster_relations.subject_entity_name: ability to connect regardless of physical distance
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Digital Information & Communication in Contemporary Society
remarks: Relation name 'enhances' chosen to capture positive functional change; could also be modeled more neutrally as 'modifies'.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Use of social media platforms promotes a sense of closeness among users.

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: when individuals share updates, photos, and thoughts

remarks: Effect is mediated by content sharing but attributed here to platform usage overall.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Social media platforms help foster a sense of community among users.

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: when individuals share updates, photos, and thoughts

remarks: Platform-level relation abstracts from specific content types.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject has a positive, beneficial effect on the quality, intensity, or strength of the object (e.g., enhancing communication, closeness, or sense of community).
args.justification: All three relations describe a positive causal/functional influence of a communication-related subject (social media or distance-defying connectivity) on social/psychological outcomes (communication quality, sense of closeness, sense of community). They share the same direction and semantic: the subject improves or strengthens the object. Normalizing to a single predicate 'enhances' captures this shared meaning and avoids minor verbal variants such as 'promotes' or 'helps foster'.

Each relation expresses how a communication technology or capability affects social experiences or psychosocial states (communication quality, perceived closeness, sense of community). Grouping them under 'social_experience_effect_relation' captures that these are technology-to-social-outcome effect links rather than generic causal or compositional relations.

All three predicates describe that the subject brings about or strengthens a particular social outcome (enhanced communication, closeness, community). This is inherently about causal influence rather than composition, identity, or pure association, so CAUSALITY is the appropriate broad group.
